1.text: These things have I spoken to you, that ye should not be offended.

2.text: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yes, the time cometh, that whoever killeth you, will think that he doeth God service.

3.text: And these things will they do to you, because they have not known the Father, nor me.

4.text: But these things have I told you, that when the time shall come, ye may remember that I told you of them. And these things I said not to you at the beginning, because I was with you.

5.text: But now I go to him that sent me, and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

6.text: But because I have said these things to you, sorrow hath filled your heart.

7.text: Nevertheless, I tell you the truth: It is expedient for you that I depart; for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come to you; but if I depart, I will send him to you.

8.text: And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

9.text: Of sin, because they believe not on me;

10.text: Of righteousness, because I go to my Father, and ye see me no more;

11.text: Of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

12.text: I have yet many things to say to you, but ye cannot bear them now.

13.text: But, when he, the Spirit of truth is come, he will guide you into all the truth: for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he shall hear, that will he speak: and he will show you things to come.

14.text: He will glorify me: for he will receive of mine, and will show it to you.

15.text: All things that the Father hath are mine: therefore I said, that he will take of mine, and show it to you.

16.text: A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me, because I go to the Father.

17.text: Then said some of his disciples among themselves, What is this that he saith to us, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?

18.text: They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? we cannot tell what he saith.

19.text: Now Jesus knew that they were desirous to ask him, and said to them, Do ye inquire among yourselves of that which I said, A little while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little while, and ye shall see me?

20.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, that ye will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice: and ye will be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.

21.text: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but as soon as she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

22.text: And ye now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.

23.text: And in that day ye will ask me nothing: Verily, verily, I say to you, Whatever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give it you.

24.text: Hitherto ye have asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.

25.text: These things have I spoken to you in proverbs: but the time cometh when I shall no more speak to you in proverbs, but I shall show you plainly concerning the Father.

26.text: At that day ye will ask in my name: and I say not to you, that I will pray the Father for you:

27.text: For the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came from God.

28.text: I came forth from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.

29.text: His disciples said to him, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no proverb.

30.text: Now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest from God.

31.text: Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?

32.text: Behold, the hour cometh, and is even now come, that ye shall be scattered every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

33.text: These things I have spoken to you, that in me ye may have peace. In the world ye will have tribulation, but be of good cheer: I have overcome the world.
